greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that k divides 2^9 + 3^9 + 5^9 + ... + prime(k)^9.
link: OEIS Wiki, Sums of powers of primes divisibility sequences.
mathematica: s = 0; Do[s = s + Prime[n]^9; If[ Mod[s, n] == 0, Print[n]], {n, 1100000}]
program: (PARI) s=0; n=0; forprime(p=2, 1e9, s+=p^9; if(s%n++==0, print1(n", "))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 14 2011
xref: Cf. A085450 (smallest m > 1 such that m divides Sum_{k=1..m} prime(k)^n).
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 25 2007, Jun 27 2007
ext: a(4) from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 27 2007
a(5)-a(10) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 14 2011
